solution_line_template: A year has {weeks_per_year} weeks, so if he talks for {minutes_per_call} minutes every week, the total number of call hours is {weeks_per_year}*{minutes_per_call} = <<{weeks_per_year}*{minutes_per_call}={total_call_minutes}>>{total_call_minutes} minutes.
Since he is charged {cost_per_minute} cents per call, the total cost is {total_call_minutes}*{cost_per_minute} = <<{total_call_minutes}*{cost_per_minute}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} dollars
